issue.title: [C++] Temporal component extraction functions don't support date32/64
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13788](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13788). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I think the functions listed here

<https://arrow.apache.org/docs/cpp/compute.html#temporal-component-extraction>

should support date32 and date64 inputs too (except: millisecond, microsecond, nanosecond and subsecond)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13788?focusedCommentId=17406582) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
I think this is a duplicate of ARROW-13138 (but certainly something we want / worth fixing!)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13788?focusedCommentId=17407580) by Percy Camilo Triveño Aucahuasi (aucahuasi):*
Duplicated

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13138

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13788?focusedCommentId=17407583) by Percy Camilo Triveño Aucahuasi (aucahuasi):*
Thanks `[~jorisvandenbossche]` ! cc `[~lidavidm]`
